titleStmt.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus"

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

locus.to: 7vb (1st Miracle of Jesus: About the Nativity); 8ra-9ra (2nd Miracle of Jesus: The Entrance of Jesus into the Temple); 109rb-110vb (3rd Miracle of Jesus: The Theft of an Heifer in Galila).

msItem.title: II. Täʾamrä Iyäsus "Miracles of Jesus"
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 6ra, l.11: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ የሁሉ[sic]፡ ላዕለ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ገብሩ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወምስለ፡ ኵልነ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወሶበ፡ በጽሐ፡ ጊዜ፡ ልደቱ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወጽአ፡ ትእዛዝ፡ እምኃበ፡ ቄሳር፡ ንጉሥ፡ ከመ፡ ይትኈለቁ፡ ኵሉ፡ ደቂቀ፡ እስራኤል፡ [Fol. 6rb] በበብሔሮሙ።...Fol. 6ra, l.11: When arrived the time of the birth of Our Lord and Our Savior Jesus Christ, a decree was proclaimed by the King that all children of Israel be counted in their respective country.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Ethiop. 15 (the time of Mǝnilǝk II), II.-1.;
BN éth. 321 (19th cent.), fols. 1ra-5ra (GrébGriaule I 53-54, no 17);

msItem.note: As the selection of miracles and the passages of the ˀAkkonu bəˀəsi indicates, the initial intention of the scribe (or creator of the archetype) was to produce a compilation of two works: the Täˀamrä Maryam wä-Iyäsus (cp. Witakowski 1995:281, cp. Uppsala O Etiop 15). However, it was dropped already in the beginning of the work; apart from the strophes of the hymn, only 3 miracles of Jesus were included, two in the beginning and one in the end.

msItem.title: I-5) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi "Does not the Man..."
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 23rb l.8: አኮኑ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሶበ፡ ሐኒፀ፡ ቤት፡ አፍተዎ፡ ኵሎ፡ ጻዕፃዎ፡ ያቀድም፡ አስተዳልዎ። ...

explicit.div: Fol. 77ra l.4: ...ጽሒፈ፡ ውዳሴኪ፡ እሙ፡ እንዘ፡ ይፈቅዱ። ኢክሉ፡ ጥንቁቀ፡ ፈጽሞ፡ ለለ፩፩። እስመ፡ ከመ፡ ኆፃ፡ ብዙኅ፡ ኢውሱን፡ ፍቅዱ።
explicit.foreign: Fol. 77ra l.4: ...Wishing to write the praise of His mother they could not encompass (the miracles) completely, absolutely, one by one, since they are many like sand and their number is unlimited.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 15 (the time of Mǝnilǝk II) (LöfUpp 100-05, no. 32);

msItem.note: Each of the 33 strophes of the hymn follows a miracles of Mary, I-4) - 34). The last strophe (n°34) of the hymn is missing.

msItem.title: I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary"
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: (1st Miracle – About Ildefonsus [Däqəsyos ] of Toledo [Ṭəlṭəlyaya]) Fol. 20ra: በስመ ፡”... ንጽሕፍ፡ በረድኤተ፡ ሀብቱ፡ በጽሒፈ፡ ተአምራቲሃ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በክልኤ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ዘኢይክሉ፡ ፈጽሞ፡ ነጊረ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ ወውዳሴሃ፡ ኢሰማያውያን፡ወኢምድራውያን፡ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ ወምሕረተ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብራ፡ ጽንፈ፡ ዜና፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።
msItem.explicit: (48th Miracle) Fol. 109ra, l. 7 : ወሀለዉ ፡ ውሉደ ፡ ውሉዱ፡ በሩካን፡ አግብርተ፡ እግዚእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እስከ፡ ዮም፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ ወአውረስቶ፡ ምሕረተ፡ [Fol. 209rb] ወልዳ። ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብራ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡ አሜን፨

msItem.title: I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wäʾǝweddǝsäki "I worship Thee…"
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 17vb: እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ ወእዌድሰኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በ፪ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ለፀሐየ፡ ጽድቅ፡ ሠረገላሁ። ...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 19ra l.4: ...ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ክብረ፡ ወሞገሰ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ወጸልዪ፡ ኀበ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልድኪ፡ ከመ፡ ይሥረይ፡ ለነ፡ ኃጣውኢነ።

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 15 (the time of Mǝnilǝk II) (LöfUpp 100), no. 32 I-C.;

msItem.title: I-2) Introductory exhortation
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 16ra: በስመ ፡”...ንነግረክሙ፡ አኃዊነ፡ ፍቁራን፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን። እግዚአብሔር፡ ይባርክሙ፡ ወያብርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ አልባቢክሙ፡ ለሰሚዓ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወድንግልት፡ በክልኤ፡ ማርያም። ... Fol. 16ra: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, one God. We will tell you, our brothers, children of the church, may God bless you and enlighten the eyes of your hearts to hear the miracles of our Lady Mary, the holy and twofold Virgin...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 17va: ...ቅድመ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ስግዱ ፡ሰዘኢሰገደ፡ ላ[Fol. 17vb]ቲ፡ይደምሰስ፡ እምቅዋሙ። ወኢይትዓወቅ፡ ዝክረ፡ ስሙ። አሜን፡ ይቤሉ፡መላእክተ፡ ሰማይ፡ ኵሎሙ። [Fol. 17va, l.19]: ... Prostr ate yourself before her image, for the name of the one who did not prostrate himself will be blotted out of existence, and the memorial of his name will not be known. And all the angels of heaven will say: "Amen".

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 11 (ca. 1660), fols. 12-14aa (LöfUpp 88, no. 30-D, "Zweite Einleitung");

msItem.title: I-1a) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 10ra: በስመ ፡”... ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሥርዓት፡ ዘወጽአ፡ እመንበረ፡ማርቆስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ እመካነ፡ መዓልቃ፡ ዘምስር፡ ዘአንበሩ፡ መምህራን፡ ሊቀ፡ጳጳሳት፡ ክቡራን፡ መጋብያነ፡ ምሥጢር፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት። ...Fol. 10ra: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the throne of Mark the Apostle, out of the church of Mäˁalqa (i.e. Al-Mu´Allaḳah) of Məsr (i.e. Cairo) wherein the Orthodox Doctors, glorious patriarchs, treasurers of the mystery had laid it up...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 15va l.5: ወለነሂ፡ በሰይፈ፡ ቃልነ፡ ለአባ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወአባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ውቁያነ፡ ወውጉዛነ፡ ይኩኑ፡ እስመ፡ ንሕነ፡ ነሣእነ፡ ሥልጣነ፡ ዚአሆሙ፡ወበእንተዝ፡ አውገዝነ፡ ወአሰርነ፡ በማዕሠር፡ ዘኢትፈታሕ፡ ወዘኢያከብር፡በዓላ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ከመ፡ እሑድ፡ ሰንበት፡ እስከ፡ አመ፡ ይመጽአ፡ወልድ፡ በስብሐ [Fol. 15vb] ት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።Fol. 15va l.5: And for us, may they be cut off and excommunicated by the sword of our word, of abba Mikaˀel and abba Gäbrəˀel, because we have received their power, and therefore we excommunicated and bind fast, with a fetter which cannot be opened until her Son will come in glory, him, who do not honour the festival of our Lady Mary like the first Sabbath. [Fol. 15vb] For ever and ever. Amen.

msItem.title: I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 3ra: በስመ ፡”... ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሥርዓት፡ ዘወጽአ፡ እመንበረ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ እመካነ፡ መዓልቃ፡ ዘምስር፡ ዘአንበሩ፡ መምህራን፡ ክቡራን፡ መጋብያነ፡ ምሥጢር፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት።...Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the throne of Mark the Apostle, out of the church of Mäˁalqa (al-Muˁallaqah) of Məsr (Cairo) wherein the Orthodox Doctors, treasurers of the mystery had laid it up...
msItem.explicit:
Fol. 5avb l.24: ...ሰላም፡ ለክሙ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወዮሐንስ፡ ወእንድርያስ
፡ [Fol. 6ra] ማቴዎስ፡ ወፊልጶስ፡ ወበርተሎሜዎስ፡ ቶማስ፡ ወያዕቆብ፡ ወልደ፡ እልፍዮስ፡ ታዴዎስ፡ ወናትናኤል፡ ወማትያስ፡ ሉቃስ፡ ወማርቆስ፡ ወያዕቆብ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ለደቂቅክሙ፡ ባርኩነ፡ በቅዱስ፡ መንፈስ ። Fol. 5avb l. 24: ...Salutation to you, Peter and Paul, Jacob and John, and Andrew [Fol. 6ra], Matthew and Philip, and Bartholomew, Thomas and Jacob, the son of Alphaeus, Thaddeus and Nathanael, and Matthias, Luke and Mark, and Jacob the bishop, bless us, your children, by the Holy Spirit.

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. has been resewn. The leather cover on the back board is cut off. Leaves of quire A and III are damaged at the lower corner (rodents).

layout.note: Text area I: fols. 3r-9v (quire I). All data for fol. 4.
layout.ab: the number of lines varies up to 28 (fol. 5a)
Ruling pricks are visible (partly of slit-type, fol. 3).
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Text area II: fols. 10r-15v (quire II). All data are for fol. 11r.
layout.ab: the number of lines varies on other fols.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Text area III: fols. 16r-19r (quire III). All data are for fol. 18r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Text area IV: fols. 20r-106v (quires IV-XIV). All data are for fol. 22r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: II. four dot asterisk; nine dot asterisk;
III. chain of black and red dots (dividing miracles); nine dot asterisks (e.g., fol. 29va).

handNote.ab: Hand a: mediocre. Hand b: irregular. Hand c, d, e: fine.
handNote.date: Hand a, b, c: 19th century. Hand d: 18th century (?). Hand e: 17th century (?).

list.item: ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 19rb-vb)

handDesc.handNote: fols. 3ra-9ra (quire I, Texts I-1a, II-a), rounded script.
fols. 10ra-15vb (quire II, Text I-1b), irregularly formed, right-sloping letters.
fols. 16ra-19ra (quire III, Texts I-2, I-3, rounded script.
fols. 20ra-106vb (quires IV-XIV, Text I-4a), broadly spaced, slight right-sloping letters.
fols. 107ra-110vb (quire XV, Texts I-4b, II-b), finely shaped, slender letters.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 10r (incipit page of Text I-1b): crude ornamental band; geometric and floral motifs (in red and blue pen).

list.item:
Fols. 1ra-2ra: Excerpt from Śərˁatä mənkwəsənna "The Order of the Monastic Profession".Fol. 1ra (incipit): በአርያም፡ ዘይነጽር፡ ላዕለ፡ ትሑታን። ዘአቀመ፡ ሰማያተ፡ በጥበቡ፡ ዘአጽንዓ፡ ለምድር፡ ዲበ፡ ማይ። ... Fol. 2ra (explicit): …ወዝንቱ፡ መዊዕ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ወይቤለኒ፡ እሉ፡ ውሉድከ፡ እንጦንስ፡ እለ፡ ለብሱ፡ አስኬማ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወገብሩ፡ ትእዛዝከ፡ ወቀብዎ፡ ሎቱ፡ በፈሪሃ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘኮኑ፡ በአምሳለ፡ አርአያነ፡ ለነ።
Written on a bifolio originating from a different Ms., added to the Ms. as endleaf.

Fol. 9ra-rb: A miracle of Mary, incomplete.
The miracle is crudely written in pen.

Fol. 19ra-rb: Hymns to St. Mary.- ˀO-ˀәgzǝˀtǝyä qəddəst dəngəl bä-kəlˀe Maryam wäladitä ˀamlak... "O my Holy Lady Mary, Two-fold Virgin, Godbearing..." (fol. 19ra-rb) - ˀO-ˀәgzǝˀtǝyä qəddəst dəngəl bä-kəlˀe Maryam Mariham ˀəmmu lä-ˀIyäsus Krǝstos kähali... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ, the Almighty..." (fol. 19rb-va)(cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki ˀo-ˀәgzǝˀtǝyä qəddəst dəngəl Maryam ˀəmmä bərhan[sic] wä-ˀəmmä bərhan... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother [of the Saviour] and Mother of the Light..." (fol. 19va-vb).
The hymns were probably written in hand b.

Fol. 111ra-rb: Excerpt from Missal (blessing).Fol. 111ra (incipit):…ልዑል፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይባርከነ፡ ወይሠለነ፡ ወያርኢ፡ ገጾ፡ ላዕሌነ፡ ወንሕየው፡ እም፡ ቃለ፡ ሕጉ፡ ወእም፡ ቃለ፡ መጻሕፍቲሁ፡ ዘገደፍነ፡ ወዘወሰክነ፡ ዘአቅደምነ፡ ወዘአድኃርነ፡ ከሀኬትነ፡ ወበድካምነ፡ ከባቲ፡ አበሳ፡ ወልዱ፡...
Fol. 111rb (explicit): ... ኦንጉሠ፡ ሠላም፡ ሠላማዊ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ሰላመከ፡ ሀበነ፡ አጽንዕ፡ ለነ፡ ሰላመከ፡ ወሥራይ፡ ለነ፡ ኃጣውኢነ፡ ነሑር፡ ወንዕቱ፡ በሰላም።
Written on an endleaf (probably added later).

Fol. 111ra: Donation note.Fol. 111ra: ዝ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘወሀባ፡ ለማርያም፡ አሲር፡ መትራ፡ የሻለ፡ ቃ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለ፡ አቡሀ፡ ቲሰፋ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለእሙ፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወለብዕሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሲ፡ ዘኦጥረ፡ ዮ፡ በንዋዮ፡ ዘሰረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ በስልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ይኩን።
Partly illegible. The note states Täsfa Maryam as buyer and donater of the Ms.

Fol. 111v: Magic prayer against snake venom.
Partly illegible.
- Crude drawings: fol. 112r-v. - Pen trial: fol. 112r

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather, textile inlays. Recent overback made of reddish-brown tooled leather (fastened with nails). Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

origin.origDate: 18th cent. (?) Quires A-III and B are of more recent time (19th cent.?).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The names of the original donors have been erased throughout the Ms. According to Additio 5, the Ms. was purchased and donated to the church by Täsfa Maryam. His name and the name of his family members has been added to the supplication formulas in the same hand as Additio 5.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
